title: Authors and Citation
text: Tang T, B (2025). coMDS: Consensus Multidimensional Scaling. R package version 0.0.0.9000.
code: @Manual{,   title = {coMDS: Consensus Multidimensional Scaling},   author = {Tiffany Tang and Bingxue An},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000}, }

title: Consensus Multidimensional Scaling
text: Different dimension reduction methods often output different possibly conflicting visualizations data. problem exacerbated choice hyperparameters, may substantially impact resulting visualization. obtain robust trustworthy dimension reduction output, develop multi-view framework called Consensus Multidimensional Scaling (CoMDS), summarizes multiple dimension reduction visualizations (e.g., PCA, t-SNE, UMAP) single consensus visualization. consensus visualization captures common structure shared across different dimension reduction methods hyperparameter settings. shared structure likely reliable idiosyncratic structures, present one small subset methods. addition CoMDS, provide local variant CoMDS, Local Consensus Multidimensional Scaling (LoCoMDS), enhances robustness preserving local consensus structures decreasing influence outliers. details, check , B., Tang, T. M. “Consensus dimension reduction via multi-view learning.” (2025).

title: Consensus Multidimensional Scaling
text: can install coMDS R package GitHub via:

title: Consensus Multidimensional Scaling
text: illustrate example usage coMDS, apply iris dataset, classic benchmark dataset containing measurements 150 iris flowers across three species.
code: # load in packages library(coMDS) library(dplyr) library(ggplot2) library(Rtsne) library(umap) library(patchwork)  # set seed set.seed(331)

title: Consensus Multidimensional Scaling
text: example, first applied three different dimension reduction methods (.e., PCA, t-SNE, UMAP) iris dataset. many real-world datasets, dimension reduction methods can yield different low-dimensional embeddings.
code: data(iris) # remove duplicates so that t-SNE can run iris <- dplyr::distinct(iris) X <- iris[, 1:4] species <- iris$Species  # fit various dimension reduction methods pca_scores <- prcomp(X, center = TRUE, scale = TRUE)$x tsne_scores <- Rtsne::Rtsne(X, dims = 2, perplexity = 30, verbose = FALSE)$Y umap_scores <- umap::umap(X, n_components = 2, n_neighbors = 30, verbose = FALSE)$layout dr_list <- list(   PCA = pca_scores,   tSNE = tsne_scores,   UMAP = umap_scores )    # plot the dimension reduction embeddings purrr::map(   dr_list,    ~ as.data.frame(.x[, 1:2]) |>      setNames(paste("Component", 1:2)) |>     dplyr::mutate(species = species) ) |>   dplyr::bind_rows(.id = ".method") |>   ggplot2::ggplot() +   ggplot2::aes(x = `Component 1`, y = `Component 2`, color = species) +   ggplot2::geom_point() +   ggplot2::facet_wrap(~ .method, scales = "free") +   ggplot2::theme_minimal()

title: Consensus Multidimensional Scaling
text: Next, can use CoMDS produce consensus embedding reflects shared, stable structure across input dimension reduction methods. leveraging multiple views, CoMDS generally provides robust trustworthy low-dimensional embedding single method alone. can visualize CoMDS consensus embeddings via examine relative error input embedding CoMDS consensus embedding via  Smaller relative errors indicate consensus embedding similar particular input dimension reduction embedding, relative input dimension reduction embeddings.
code: # fit coMDS comds_out <- coMDS(embed_list = dr_list, ndim = 2) plot_coMDS(comds_out, color = species) plot_coMDS(comds_out, type = "relative_error")

title: Consensus Multidimensional Scaling
text: Alternatively, LoCoMDS can applied embeddings produce consensus embedding prioritizes local consensus structure (opposed global consensus structure CoMDS). LoCoMDS particularly useful input embeddings contain outliers input embeddings inherently local (e.g., t-SNE, UMAP). two hyperparameters LoCoMDS: tau, controls degree locality, percentile, controls threshold defining local neighborhoods. can visualize LoCoMDS consensus embeddings via  examine relative error input embedding CoMDS consensus embedding via  LoCoMDS can run either single choice hyperparameters (), can tuned across multiple choices hyperparameters select best consensus embedding.  LoCoMDS run multiple choices hyperparameters, tune_locoMDS function can used select best consensus embedding based adjusted local continuity meta-criterion (LCMC). Higher adjusted LCMC values indicate better fit. case, appears average across different LCMC neighborhood sizes, percentile = 0.8 yields higher adjusted LCMCs percentile = 0.5 choice tau make noticeable difference. Given particular choice tau percentile, can extract LoCoMDS consensus embedding hyperparameters via plot tuned LoCoMDS consensus embedding corresponding relative errors plot, can use  can alternatively examine consensus embeddings relative errors combinations hyperparameters via
code: # fit LoCoMDS with single choice of hyperparameters locomds_single_out <- locoMDS(   embed_list = dr_list, ndim = 2, tau = 0.01, percentile = 0.5 ) plot_coMDS(locomds_single_out, color = species) plot_coMDS(locomds_single_out, type = "relative_error") # fit LoCoMDS and tune across multiple choices of hyperparameters locomds_multi_out <- locoMDS(   embed_list = dr_list, ndim = 2, tau = c(0.01, 0.1), percentile = c(0.5, 0.8) ) # tune LoCoMDS output locomds_tune_out <- tune_locoMDS(locomds_multi_out, data = X) locomds_tune_out$plot locomds_tuned_out <- extract_locoMDS(locomds_multi_out, tau = 0.1, percentile = 0.8) p1 <- plot_coMDS(locomds_tuned_out, color = species) p2 <- plot_coMDS(locomds_tuned_out, type = "relative_error") patchwork::wrap_plots(p1, p2, nrow = 1) p1 <- plot_coMDS(locomds_multi_out, color = species) p2 <- plot_coMDS(locomds_multi_out, type = "relative_error") patchwork::wrap_plots(p1, p2, nrow = 1)

Consensus Multidimensional Scaling (CoMDS) — coMDS
text: Consensus Multidimensional Scaling (CoMDS)

title: Consensus Multidimensional Scaling (CoMDS) — coMDS
code: coMDS(   D_list,   embed_list = NULL,   ndim = 2,   constraint = c("indscal", "idioscal", "identity"),   ... )

title: Consensus Multidimensional Scaling (CoMDS) — coMDS
text: D_list List distance matrices. embed_list Optional list embeddings compute distances . provided, pairwise Euclidean distances computed embedded samples used lieu D_list. ndim Number dimensions output embedding. Default 2. constraint Type weight constraint use CoMDS algorithm. Options "indscal" (default), "idioscal", "identity" ... Additional arguments passed smacofIndDiff() function.

title: Consensus Multidimensional Scaling (CoMDS) — coMDS
text: list containing following components: gspace: Consensus embedding matrix size n x ndim, n number samples. cweights: list learned weight matrices input embedding/ distance matrix. stress: final stress value CoMDS solution. spp: Stress per point (percent). rss: Residual sum squares. spps: Stress per point per input embedding/distance matrix (percent, conditional input embedding/distance matrix). sps: Stress per input embedding/distance matrix (percent). sps_norm: Stress per input embedding/distance matrix (percent), normalized sum source weights. ndim: Number dimensions consensus embedding. model: Type smacof model. niter: Number iterations run. nobj: Number points/samples. type: MDS type used (e.g., "interval", "ratio", "ordinal", "mspline"). constraint: Type weight constraint used CoMDS algorithm. call: matched call function.

title: Consensus Multidimensional Scaling (CoMDS) — coMDS
code: data(iris) # remove duplicates so that tSNE can run X <- dplyr::distinct(iris[, 1:4])  # fit various dimension reduction methods pca_scores <- prcomp(X, center = TRUE, scale = TRUE)$x tsne_scores <- Rtsne::Rtsne(X, dims = 2, perplexity = 30, verbose = FALSE)$Y umap_scores <- umap::umap(X, n_components = 2, verbose = FALSE)$layout dr_list <- list(   pca = pca_scores,   tsne = tsne_scores,   umap = umap_scores )  # fit coMDS using dimension reduction embeddings directly as input comds_out <- coMDS(embed_list = dr_list, ndim = 2)  # fit coMDS using distance matrices as input dist_list <- purrr::map(dr_list, ~ dist(.x, method = "euclidean")) comds_out <- coMDS(D_list = dist_list, ndim = 2)  # can re-run with larger number of iterations or smaller tolerance if desired comds_out <- coMDS(D_list = dist_list, ndim = 2, itmax = 500, eps = 1e-8)

title: Extract LoCoMDS fit for particular tau and percentile — extract_locoMDS

title: Extract LoCoMDS fit for particular tau and percentile — extract_locoMDS
code: data(iris) # remove duplicates so that tSNE can run X <- dplyr::distinct(iris[, 1:4])  # fit various dimension reduction methods pca_scores <- prcomp(X, center = TRUE, scale = TRUE)$x tsne_scores <- Rtsne::Rtsne(X, dims = 2, perplexity = 30, verbose = FALSE)$Y umap_scores <- umap::umap(X, n_components = 2, verbose = FALSE)$layout dr_list <- list(   pca = pca_scores,   tsne = tsne_scores,   umap = umap_scores )  # fit LoCoMDS with multiple possible hyperparameters locomds_fits_all <- locoMDS(   embed_list = dr_list, ndim = 2, tau = c(0.01, 0.1), percentile = c(0.5, 0.8) )  # extract LoCoMDS with specific hyperparameters locomds_fit <- extract_locoMDS(locomds_fits_all, tau = 0.1, percentile = 0.5)

title: Evaluate Local Continuity Meta-Criterion (LCMC) — lcmc
Evaluate Local Continuity Meta-Criterion (LCMC) — lcmc
text: x Raw data/embeddings original space. y Raw data/embeddings new (dimension-reduced) space. ks Vector neighborhood sizes evaluate LCMC. fit (Optional) Fitted locoMDS object corresponding embeddings y. used warning messages uniqueness points.

title: Evaluate Local Continuity Meta-Criterion (LCMC) — lcmc
text: data frame columns: k: Neighborhood size. lcmc: Local Continuity Meta-Criterion value given neighborhood size. adjusted_lcmc: Adjusted LCMC value, accounting neighborhood size.

title: Evaluate Local Continuity Meta-Criterion (LCMC) — lcmc
code: # generate example data n <- 100 p1 <- 4 p2 <- 2 x <- matrix(rnorm(n * p1), nrow = n, ncol = p1) y <- matrix(rnorm(n * p2), nrow = n, ncol = p2)  # evaluate LCMC for neighborhood sizes 5, 10, and 20 lcmc_out <- lcmc(x, y, ks = c(5, 10, 20))

what: SMACOF for Individual Differences with local neighborhoods — localSmacofIndDiff
title: SMACOF for Individual Differences with local neighborhoods — localSmacofIndDiff
text: Variant smacof::smacofIndDiff() local MDS local neighborhoods.

title: SMACOF for Individual Differences with local neighborhoods — localSmacofIndDiff
code: localSmacofIndDiff(   delta,   tau,   percentile,   ndim = 2,   type = c("ratio", "interval", "ordinal", "mspline"),   constraint = c("indscal", "idioscal", "identity"),   weights = NULL,   weightlam = 0,   init = "torgerson",   ties = "primary",   verbose = FALSE,   modulus = 1,   itmax = 100,   eps = 1e-06,   spline.degree = 2,   spline.intKnots = 2 )

title: SMACOF for Individual Differences with local neighborhoods — localSmacofIndDiff
text: delta list dissimilarity matrices list objects class dist tau Regularization parameter. percentile Percentile used define local neighborhoods. Larger percentiles result larger neighborhoods. ndim Number dimensions type MDS type: "interval", "ratio", "ordinal" (nonmetric MDS), "mspline" constraint Either "indscal", "idioscal", "identity" (see details) weights Vector length equal number distance matrices. provided, weights distance matrix multiplied corresponding value weights. Default NULL give distance matrix weight (.e., scaled 1). weightlam Regularization parameter weight matrices avoid singularity matrices. Default 0 (.e., regularization). regularization needed, set small value (e.g., 1e-6). init Matrix starting values configurations (optional) ties Tie specification non-metric MDS verbose TRUE, intermediate stress printed modulus Number smacof iterations per monotone regression call itmax Maximum number iterations eps Convergence criterion spline.degree Degree spline "mspline" MDS type spline.intKnots Number interior knots spline "mspline" MDS type

title: Local Consensus Multidimensional Scaling (LoCoMDS) — locoMDS
text: Local Consensus Multidimensional Scaling (LoCoMDS)

title: Local Consensus Multidimensional Scaling (LoCoMDS) — locoMDS
code: locoMDS(   D_list,   embed_list = NULL,   tau,   percentile,   ndim = 2,   constraint = c("indscal", "idioscal", "identity"),   ... )

title: Local Consensus Multidimensional Scaling (LoCoMDS) — locoMDS
text: D_list List distance matrices. embed_list Optional list embeddings compute distances . provided, pairwise Euclidean distances computed embedded samples used lieu D_list. tau Regularization parameter. Can scalar vector. percentile Percentile used define local neighborhoods. Larger percentiles result larger neighborhoods. Can scalar vector. ndim Number dimensions output embedding. Default 2. constraint Type weight constraint use CoMDS algorithm. Options "indscal" (default), "idioscal", "identity" ... Additional arguments passed smacofIndDiff() function.

title: Local Consensus Multidimensional Scaling (LoCoMDS) — locoMDS
text: list containing following components: gspace: Consensus embedding matrix size n x ndim, n number samples. cweights: list learned weight matrices input embedding/ distance matrix. stress: final stress value CoMDS solution. rss: Residual sum squares. spp: Stress per point (percent). spps: Stress per point per input embedding/distance matrix (percent, conditional input embedding/distance matrix). sps: Stress per input embedding/distance matrix (percent). sps_norm: Stress per input embedding/distance matrix (percent), normalized sum source weights. ndim: Number dimensions consensus embedding. model: Type smacof model. tau: regularization parameter used LoCoMDS algorithm. percentile: percentile used define local neighborhoods. niter: Number iterations run. nobj: Number points/samples. type: MDS type used (e.g., "interval", "ratio", "ordinal", "mspline"). constraint: Type weight constraint used CoMDS algorithm. call: matched call function. multiple hyperparameter combinations provided, output list LoCoMDS objects, corresponding different combination tau percentile.

title: Local Consensus Multidimensional Scaling (LoCoMDS) — locoMDS
code: data(iris) # remove duplicates so that tSNE can run X <- dplyr::distinct(iris[, 1:4])  # fit various dimension reduction methods pca_scores <- prcomp(X, center = TRUE, scale = TRUE)$x tsne_scores <- Rtsne::Rtsne(X, dims = 2, perplexity = 30, verbose = FALSE)$Y umap_scores <- umap::umap(X, n_components = 2, verbose = FALSE)$layout dr_list <- list(   pca = pca_scores,   tsne = tsne_scores,   umap = umap_scores )  # fit LoCoMDS using dimension reduction embeddings directly as input locomds_out <- locoMDS(   embed_list = dr_list, ndim = 2, tau = 0.1, percentile = 0.5 ) #> Warning: Iteration limit reached! Increase itmax argument!  # fit LoCoMDS using distance matrices as input dist_list <- purrr::map(dr_list, ~ dist(.x, method = "euclidean")) locomds_out <- locoMDS(   D_list = dist_list, ndim = 2, tau = 0.1, percentile = 0.5 ) #> Warning: Iteration limit reached! Increase itmax argument!  # can re-run with larger number of iterations or smaller tolerance if desired locomds_out <- locoMDS(   D_list = dist_list, ndim = 2, tau = 0.1, percentile = 0.5,   itmax = 500, eps = 1e-8 )  # fit LoCoMDS with multiple possible hyperparameters locomds_out <- locoMDS(   D_list = dist_list, ndim = 2, tau = c(0.01, 0.1), percentile = c(0.5, 0.8) ) #> Warning: Iteration limit reached! Increase itmax argument! #> Warning: Iteration limit reached! Increase itmax argument!

what: Normalize list of distance matrices — normalize_distances
title: Normalize list of distance matrices — normalize_distances
text: function normalizes list distance matrices top singular value normalization, distance matrix top singular value 1. ensures distance matrices similar scales, making CoMDS optimization problem stable easier optimize.

title: Normalize list of distance matrices — normalize_distances
Normalize list of distance matrices — normalize_distances
text: D_list List distance matrices.

title: Normalize list of distance matrices — normalize_distances
text: list normalized distance matrices (class dist).

title: Normalize list of distance matrices — normalize_distances
code: data(iris) # remove duplicates so that tSNE can run X <- dplyr::distinct(iris[, 1:4])  # fit various dimension reduction methods pca_scores <- prcomp(X, center = TRUE, scale = TRUE)$x tsne_scores <- Rtsne::Rtsne(X, dims = 2, perplexity = 30, verbose = FALSE)$Y umap_scores <- umap::umap(X, n_components = 2, verbose = FALSE)$layout dr_list <- list(   pca = pca_scores,   tsne = tsne_scores,   umap = umap_scores )  # convert embeddings to distance matrices dist_list <- purrr::map(dr_list, ~ dist(.x, method = "euclidean")) # normalize distance matrices dist_list_norm <- normalize_distances(dist_list)

what: Plotting function for coMDS and locoMDS objects — plot_coMDS
title: Plotting function for coMDS and locoMDS objects — plot_coMDS
text: Plotting function coMDS locoMDS objects

title: Plotting function for coMDS and locoMDS objects — plot_coMDS
Plotting function for coMDS and locoMDS objects — plot_coMDS
text: obj coMDS object, locoMDS object, list locoMDS objects (e.g., output locoMDS() multiple hyperparameter combinations). color Optional vector colors points plot. used type "scores". NULL, color applied. type Character string indicating type visualization. Can either "scores" "relative_errors" show consensus component scores relative errors input source, respectively. Default "scores". ... Additional arguments passed ggplot2::geom_point() type "scores" ggplot2::geom_bar() type "relative_errors".

title: Plotting function for coMDS and locoMDS objects — plot_coMDS
text: ggplot object visualizing consensus components input object.

title: Plotting function for coMDS and locoMDS objects — plot_coMDS
code: data(iris) # remove duplicates so that tSNE can run iris <- dplyr::distinct(iris) X <- iris[, 1:4] species <- iris$Species  # fit various dimension reduction methods pca_scores <- prcomp(X, center = TRUE, scale = TRUE)$x tsne_scores <- Rtsne::Rtsne(X, dims = 2, perplexity = 30, verbose = FALSE)$Y umap_scores <- umap::umap(X, n_components = 2, verbose = FALSE)$layout dr_list <- list(   pca = pca_scores,   tsne = tsne_scores,   umap = umap_scores )  # fit coMDS using dimension reduction embeddings directly as input comds_out <- coMDS(embed_list = dr_list, ndim = 2) # plot coMDS scores plot_coMDS(comds_out, color = species, type = "scores")  # plot coMDS relative errors plot_coMDS(comds_out, type = "relative_errors")   # fit LoCoMDS with specific hyperparameters locomds_out <- locoMDS(   embed_list = dr_list, ndim = 2, tau = 0.1, percentile = 0.5 ) # plot LoCoMDS scores plot_coMDS(locomds_out, color = species, type = "scores")  # plot LoCoMDS relative errors plot_coMDS(locomds_out, type = "relative_errors")   # fit LoCoMDS with multiple possible hyperparameters locomds_multi_out <- locoMDS(   embed_list = dr_list, ndim = 2, tau = c(0.01, 0.1), percentile = c(0.5, 0.8) ) # plot LoCoMDS scores for multiple hyperparameters plot_coMDS(locomds_multi_out, color = species, type = "scores")  # plot LoCoMDS relative errors for multiple hyperparameters plot_coMDS(locomds_multi_out, type = "relative_errors")

title: SMACOF for Individual Differences — smacofIndDiff
code: smacofIndDiff(   delta,   ndim = 2,   type = c("ratio", "interval", "ordinal", "mspline"),   constraint = c("indscal", "idioscal", "identity"),   weights = NULL,   weightmat = NULL,   weightlam = 0,   init = "torgerson",   ties = "primary",   verbose = FALSE,   modulus = 1,   itmax = 100,   eps = 1e-06,   spline.degree = 2,   spline.intKnots = 2 )

title: SMACOF for Individual Differences — smacofIndDiff
text: delta list dissimilarity matrices list objects class dist ndim Number dimensions type MDS type: "interval", "ratio", "ordinal" (nonmetric MDS), "mspline" constraint Either "indscal", "idioscal", "identity" (see details) weights Vector length equal number distance matrices. provided, weights distance matrix multiplied corresponding value weights. Default NULL give distance matrix weight (.e., scaled 1). weightmat Optional matrix dissimilarity weights weightlam Regularization parameter weight matrices avoid singularity matrices. Default 0 (.e., regularization). regularization needed, set small value (e.g., 1e-6). init Matrix starting values configurations (optional) ties Tie specification non-metric MDS verbose TRUE, intermediate stress printed modulus Number smacof iterations per monotone regression call itmax Maximum number iterations eps Convergence criterion spline.degree Degree spline "mspline" MDS type spline.intKnots Number interior knots spline "mspline" MDS type

text: list two components: lcmc: data frame containing LCMC values neighborhood size hyperparameter combination. plots: ggplot object showing LCMC values across neighborhood sizes hyperparameters.

title: Tune hyperparameters for LoCoMDS — tune_locoMDS
code: data(iris) # remove duplicates so that tSNE can run X <- dplyr::distinct(iris[, 1:4])  # fit various dimension reduction methods pca_scores <- prcomp(X, center = TRUE, scale = TRUE)$x tsne_scores <- Rtsne::Rtsne(X, dims = 2, perplexity = 30, verbose = FALSE)$Y umap_scores <- umap::umap(X, n_components = 2, verbose = FALSE)$layout dr_list <- list(   pca = pca_scores,   tsne = tsne_scores,   umap = umap_scores )  # fit LoCoMDS with multiple possible hyperparameters locomds_fits_all <- locoMDS(   embed_list = dr_list, ndim = 2, tau = c(0.01, 0.1), percentile = c(0.5, 0.8) )  # tune LoCoMDS hyperparameters locomds_tuning <- tune_locoMDS(locomds_fits_all, data = X)
